educational.title: Educational Report
educational.purpose: Reports on educational facilities, programs, or learning initiatives within your organization.

introduction.label: A: Introduction & Context
introduction.purpose: State the purpose, scope, and explain how information was gathered.
phrases: The aim of this report is to assess [topic] and suggest improvements.
This report looks at [topic] in order to identify what works well and what needs improving.
The purpose of this report is to evaluate [topic] for [group/audience].
This report provides an overview of [topic], focusing on strengths and weaknesses.
The report is based on feedback from [students/participants] and my own observations.
The information was collected through a short survey of [students/visitors].
The findings come from comments made by [group] during [event/time period].
This report is based on interviews with [group] and informal feedback.
The research for this report was conducted over [time period].
Information was gathered through [questionnaires/interviews/observation].
This assessment draws on responses from [number] participants.
The data presented here comes from both quantitative and qualitative sources.

neutral.label: B: Neutral General Views
neutral.purpose: Present balanced, objective observations without strong praise or criticism.
phrases: Overall, most people felt that [topic] was [reasonable/acceptable/adequate].
On the whole, respondents had mixed views about [aspect].
The general consensus was that [topic] met basic expectations.
It is generally agreed that [aspect] functions at a satisfactory level.
Most participants acknowledged that [topic] serves its intended purpose.

The prevailing view is that [aspect] operates within acceptable parameters.

It was noted that [aspect] performs adequately in most circumstances.
Survey results show a moderate level of satisfaction with [topic].
Participants generally described [aspect] as functional and practical.

praising.label: C: Praising
praising.purpose: Highlight specific strengths, successes, and positive aspects.
phrases: One thing that worked really well was [positive point].
A definite strength was [strength].

What makes [aspect] particularly valuable is [reason].

Many respondents highlighted [feature] as an outstanding feature.
One impressive aspect is the way [topic] manages to [achievement].
It should be emphasized that [strength] represents a significant achievement.
Feedback was overwhelmingly positive regarding [aspect].
The success of [feature] demonstrates [positive quality].
Particularly noteworthy is [aspect], which has proven highly effective.

criticising.label: D: Criticising
criticising.purpose: Identify specific problems, weaknesses, and areas requiring attention.
phrases: However, a common complaint was that [problem].
One major issue was [issue], mainly because [reason].
[aspect] was not ideal, especially when [situation/example].
This seems to be caused by [cause], which affects [result].
By far the worst aspect of [topic] is [problem].
A significant concern raised by many was [issue].
Unfortunately, [aspect] falls short in several key areas.
One persistent problem is [issue], which has been mentioned repeatedly.
There are serious concerns about [aspect], particularly regarding [specific issue].
Many participants expressed frustration with [problem].
A major drawback is [issue], which impacts [consequence].
It must be acknowledged that [aspect] requires urgent attention.
Feedback highlighted several deficiencies in [area].
The most frequently cited complaint was [problem].
Disappointingly, [aspect] has not lived up to expectations.
Critical feedback focused on [issue], with many stating that [specific complaint].
One area that clearly needs improvement is [aspect].

recommending.label: E: Recommending
recommending.purpose: Propose specific, actionable solutions and improvements.
phrases: To improve [aspect], it would be a good idea to [suggestion].
One simple way to fix this would be to [action].
It is recommended that [action] is introduced to deal with [issue].
If this change is made, it would help [group] because [benefit].
Another option would be to [alternative], which could reduce [problem].
A practical step would be to [step], leading to [benefit].
It would be advisable to [action] in order to address [issue].
The most effective solution would be to [recommendation].
To prevent [problem] from recurring, [action] should be implemented.
I would strongly recommend [action], as this would [benefit].
One way to enhance [aspect] would be to [suggestion].
In order to maximize [outcome], it is essential that [action].
A priority should be to [recommendation], which would [result].
The school/organization should consider investing in [resource].
If [group] were to [action], the benefits would include [advantages].
An immediate improvement would be to [suggestion].
To address these concerns, I propose [recommendation].

conclusion.label: F: Conclusion
conclusion.purpose: Summarise key points, synthesize findings, and provide final perspective.
phrases: In conclusion, [topic] works well overall, but [area] needs improvement.
To sum up, the main strengths are [strengths], while the biggest issue is [issue].
Taking everything into account, the most important improvement would be [key recommendation].
Overall, these changes would make a real difference for [group].
In summary, the recommendations above would lead to a better experience for [group].
All things considered, [topic] demonstrates [overall assessment].
The findings clearly indicate that [main conclusion].
On balance, while [positive], there is scope for improvement in [area].
To conclude, implementing these suggestions would significantly enhance [aspect].

The evidence suggests that [conclusion], provided that [condition].
